div.p: The banking facilities of this place are found to be much top then the exiquicies of business require. Their is no exchange to be had at this time upon any point except Nashville. As a consequence, niucautile men are subjected to inconviences; and the balance of the community are made to pay for it in an increased price of goods &c. This is occasioned by our Bank being dependant upon the parent Bank at Nashville; and not being allowed to extend its operations further than the Nashville directory way choose.

The Legislature at the Session of 1843-4, suacts of the Session Chapter II. X. pays 65. granted a charter to establish the Bank of East Tennessee. Under the provision of that charter the stock was subscribed and enough paid in to secure the charters. For reasons not neccessary to be dwelt upon, the bank has not yet been put into operation, as you are aware-

Apearance is given, however, that it shall go into operation at once provided a small award went can be made in the charter. The award went proposed relates to the number of Directors. By the 4th Section of the Charter twelve directors are required. This number while by dividing the responsibility among so many persons it gives no greater apearance to the community, is at the same time so great as to be unwieldy and discordant It is proposed to aurcudthe 4th section of the charter so that instead of twelve Directors their shall be but six

That it is deirable for the cirurur cial interests of East Tennessee that she should have banking privileges independept of Nashville, is a question about which their can be no doubt. Will you, therefor, use your influence in the Legislation to hair the ammendment maide, as above sugested, and these oblige, Your Friends
